attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A campaign to save Rhyl's historic Queen's Arcade - a former ballroom mecca 
 
The Queen's Arcade in the Denbighshire town dates back to Victorian times. 

Steve, Jo Francis and Stuart Jones from the town are campaigning to protect the building and have started a petition. 

Denbighshire Council leader Rhiannon Hughes said should the site be sold for redevelopment she would want to see the work done in a "sympathetic" way. 

The building, which once housed a hotel, theatre and ballroom, dates back to the early 1900s and is currently used as a shopping arcade. 

Dance floor 

In its heyday, this place was fantastic, it had a huge theatre with all the stars. There was a waxworks and a skating rink. You could stay here all day and be entertained.

Laurel and Hardy, Cliff Richard, Italia Conti, Anne Heywood and Julie Andrews all performed in the theatre. 

Its ballroom had a sprung maple dance floor that could accommodate 2.000 couples, even having British Champions dance there. 

We fear the arcade's days are numbered as Rhyl undergoes a series of re-developments.

Please Mr Priminister can you help us.
